author: thepiones
body:
Thinking about WDC... Seagate bombed, but cloud has been going up with covid,Soo... Where are the hdds coming from?

Please tell me why that's stupid

author: lloydgross24
body:
Thoughts on Western Digital calls for earnings?

All the other computer hardware plays have been destroying. But Seagate tanked.

author: Throwawayeconboi
body: Good point, missed that about Seagate. Glad I didn't play WDC then! Haha

author: TechnicalEntry
body: Seagate reported last week and was slaughtered.

author: Pijoto
body: \*shrug\*  Seagate gets like 90% of their revenue from low margin and declining HDD sales, while HDDs account for only around half of WDC's revenue, and their SSD market keeps growing with more potential upside with the new console generation driving more demand for high speed NVME drives.  If WDC stock does drop, I don't see it being anywhere near severe as Seagate...so, I'm willing to take that bet on a potential pop in prices.

author: GTFOScience
body:
STX

INTC

author: penguino_fabulous
body:
Top positions are 
* TDG - 20%
* ROP - 16%
* MO - 10%
* NOC, RTX, SAIC, CACI, BWXT, LHX - all 5-6% each
* Several smaller positions including URI, PM, FNV, STX comprise the rest

author: Rhaximus
body:
MU is better than ever and an undervalued company. Its problem is they pretty much only make DRAM, which is a very low profit business, and additionally have a huge amount of trendy competition from companies like Samsung, TSM, AMD, NVDA, Seagate, SanDisk, etc.

Big money allocates sector money selectively and MU doesn't make the cut anymore.

author: YoYo_Da
body: Seagate totally missed EPS by a ton on the 28th, crashed after. That should've been a heads-up for WD. If I had to guess, demand for physical storage (at least on the retail side if not enterprise) is likely down right now in comparison to cloud storage, which I'd guess is up for both retail and enterprise consumers.

author: Grunblau
body:
Picking up the shattered pieces of my WDC AH...  

I expect everyone to eventually realize that there are only two major players in the HDD space (Seagate and Western Digital) and only one of them that is heavily into NAND because of its ownership of SanDisk.  Long term hold, I guess.

author: iredditacc
body: Both STX and WDC failed and cloud storage also decelerated so where are you motherfuckers storing your files smh

author: TechnicalEntry
body: Seagate reported last week, go check out how they did...

author: jpowpump
body: Seagate almost only make hard drives which is a dying breed of storage. Western digital is a top 4 NAND manufacturer.

author: j33tAy
body:
hmm okay, makes sense

i've been going in the 40-60% range mostly

BAC, AMD, WFC, STX are my favorites lately for selling CC along with some sector ETFs like XLF and XLE

though, i am selling some absurd IV calls too on NAK, TRVN and HBP so yeah....

author: MSaffold
body: STX making expansion SSDs for the new xbox btw

author: solidmussel
body:
Buffet has tons of winners other than apple.

Visa, Mastercard,  American express, verisign, Amazon,  costco, kroger. 

But the biggest position by far is Apple at 134bn.  His whole portfolio is 260bn.  So that seems like a win

body:
Buffet has tons of winners other than apple.

Visa, Mastercard,  American express, verisign, Amazon,  costco, kroger. 

But the biggest position by far is Apple at 134bn.  His whole portfolio is 260bn.  So that seems like a win
